thread.title: Later departure for Seattle-Portland evening train
thread.title_full: Later departure for Seattle-Portland evening train

author: The Chronicle (Centralia)
title: Later departure for Seattle-Portland evening train
text:
Later departure for Seattle-Portland evening train Originally published July 2, 2015 at 3:13 pm Permanent schedule change for Amtrak Cascades train starting July 11; train will leave at 6.05 p.m. instead of 5.30 p.m. The Seattle Times 
Amtrak Cascades’ Seattle evening train to Portland will have a new departure time starting July 11. 
Train 509 will depart 35 minutes later at 6:05 p.m. The permanent change will better accommodate business travelers, and give visitors more time to enjoy Seattle. 
This summer, Amtrak Cascades passengers will also enjoy quicker trips between Seattle and Portland. From July 11 through Sept. 13, daily trains numbered 500, 501, 507, 508, 509 and 516 will arrive at their final destinations 10 minutes sooner. The trip will now be a 3 hours, 40 minute trip. Two of the trains will have different departure times, with the 501 leaving at 7:25 a.m. and the 507 leaving at 2:10 p.m. 
Over a year ago, the Washington State Department of Transportation added extra time to some routes to accommodate ongoing rail improvement construction projects, but officials limited those interruptions this summer. Most Read Stories
